pages.text: $(pot)Crock Pot$() is a block that is used to cook a variety of belly-filling dishes with basic ingredients.$(br)A $(pot)Crock Pot$() has 4 slots for ingredients, each of which must be filled with a piece of food for it to start cooking. There's also a slot for fuel, which uses regular furnace fuel.

There are many recipes available for the $(pot)Crock Pot$(), but a successful cooking attempt requires all the ingredients to match a recipe. If an attempt fails to match any recipe at all, you'll end up with $(item)Wet Goop$() as the cooking result.

A cooking attempt also takes account of all the ingredient values that the provided foods contain. Almost all recipes require some amount of $(l:intro/ingredient)ingredient values$() from certain food categories, but there's also a lot of recipes with specific food requirements.

Lots of ingredients fulfill recipe requirements more efficiently than others (e.g. 1 $(item)Porkchop$() has the same effect on a dish as 2 $(item)Chicken$()). More filling ingredients tend to have greater food values.$(br2)Each recipe also has a weight, so that a result can be decided when a set of ingredients matches more than one valid recipe. These weights are called recipe $(l:intro/priority)priorities$().
There are 3 tiers of $(pot)Crock Pot$(). Some recipes need a higher tier of $(pot)Crock Pot$() to cook. Higher tier of $(pot)Crock Pots$() also have faster cooking speeds.
